=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: LEGO Ninjago: Masters of Spinjitzu: Season 2
Review Date: 2014/09/17
Store: Michael Helmuth Hansen  (Director),     Trylle Vilstrup  (Director),     Vincent Tong  (Actor),     Kirby Morrow  (Actor)    &                   1                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Musicals & Performing Arts
Product Description: ['LEGO Ninjago: Masters of Spinjitzu Season Two', 'Since Lord Garmadon’s disappearance from the Underworld, Ninjago has been at peace; but when Garmadon’s son, Lloyd, releases the five ancient warring tribes of the Serpentine, the Ninja had to learn how to unlock their full potential in order to combat the growing threat. The Ninja also learned of a prophecy that one of them will become the Green Ninja – a warrior destined to defeat the Dark Lord in the ultimate battle of good versus evil. In the first season, the Ninjas unlocked their full elemental powers. Meanwhile, the Serpentine released the all-consuming snake known as the Great Devourer. In the climactic finale, the Ninja had to rely on Lord Garmadon and his ability to wield the Four Golden Weapons in order to destroy the Great Devourer and bring peace. In the end, the Ninja are heralded as heroes, but Lord Garmadon has disappeared with the very weapons he needed in order to turn Ninjago into his evil image.', ']]>']
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Animation', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Animated, Color, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Brian Drummond, IRENE SPARRE, John Novak, Mark Oliver, Trylle Vilstrup, Erik Wilstrup, Michael Adamthwaite, Martin Skov, Michael Helmuth Hansen, Vincent Tong, Mackenzie Gray, Kirby Morrow, Jillian Michaels, Kelly Metzger, Colin Murdock, Brent Miller, Torsten Jacobsen, Paul DobsonBrian Drummond, IRENE SPARRE, John Novak, Mark Oliver, Trylle Vilstrup, Erik Wilstrup, Michael Adamthwaite, Martin Skov, Michael Helmuth Hansen, Vincent Tong, Mackenzie Gray, Kirby Morrow, Jillian Michaels, Kelly Metzger, Colin Murdock, Brent Miller, Torsten Jacobsen…  See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround)', 'Number Of Discs': '2', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 3.2 Ounces', 'Item model number': '26337710', 'Director': 'Michael Helmuth Hansen, Trylle Vilstrup, Martin Skov', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Animated, Color, NTSC', 'Run time': '4 hours and 46 minutes', 'Release date': 'March 5, 2013', 'Actors': 'Vincent Tong, Kirby Morrow, Michael Adamthwaite, Brent Miller, Paul Dobson', 'Producers': 'IRENE SPARRE, Torsten Jacobsen, Erik Wilstrup', 'Studio': 'WarnerBrothers', 'Number of discs': '2'}
Review Text: This is a great fantasy series which grandparents can enjoy with their lego-obsessed grandsons, then go out and get some of the sets and build the vehicles etc.  Not lacking in moral content, either.  The boy is going to be Lloyd, the green ninja, this halloween.
Review Title: This is a great fantasy series which grandparents can enjoy with their lego-obsessed ...
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
LEGO Ninjago Masters of Spinjitzu (DVD)
Various  (Actor, Director)    Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Warner Home Video
['Product Description', 'LEGO Ninjago Masters of Spinjitzu', 'Masters of Spinjitzu: a new force to save the world! The world of Ninjago is in terrible danger. An army of skeletons has invaded from the underworld, under the command of the evil Lord Garmadon. Their goal: capture the Four Weapons of Spinjitzu, artifacts so powerful it is said no one being can wield them all at once. Now Garmadon’s brother, the heroic Sensei Wu, must gather four young men and train them in the ways of the ancient art of Spinjitzu. These four – Kai, Jay, Zane and Cole – must become ninja and stand against the dark power of Garmadon and his evil skeleton army. If they fail, the four weapons will be lost and Ninjago doomed forever.', ']]>', 'Amazon.com', 'The two-part adventure', 'Ninjago: Masters of Spinjitzu', "is based on a line of toys Lego introduced in 2011. Kai, a young blacksmith, is eager--too eager--to forge a great sword. He initially snubs the unassuming Sensei Wu, the master of Spinjitzu martial arts. When Kai's sister Nya is kidnapped by Samukai and his skeleton army from the Underworld, Wu realizes the evil Garmadon is using Samukai to find four legendary weapons that will give him enormous power. Wu trains Kai to join his student-warriors, Jay, Zane, and Cole, and keep Garmadon from seizing power.", 'Masters of Spinjitzu', "is a lightweight, product-based adventure, but it's not a terribly original one. The training sequence, which pits Kai against a series of armed mechanical devices, borrows heavily from", 'Kung Fu Panda', '. Other elements recall', 'Naruto', 'and', 'Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles', ', and the filmmakers blithely mix Chinese, Japanese, and Western elements. But little kids who love their Lego toys will probably overlook these shortcoming and enjoy the adventure, which is obviously designed to kick off a series. Parents should be prepared to field requests for the many toys that appear in', 'Masters of Spinjitzu', '. (Unrated; suitable for ages 5 and older: cartoon violence)', '--Charles Solomon']
{'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': '25195594', 'Director': 'Various', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Animated', 'Run time': '44 minutes', 'Release date': 'March 27, 2012', 'Actors': 'Various', 'Studio': 'WarnerBrothers', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Our 5 year old grandson can't get enough of the Ninjago series.  I wish all of season 3 would be available in the USA, but apparently it's not.  (Why can other countries get it and we can't? Bummer!)  One thing I, as a septuagenarian adult, like very much is that the characters have a moral compass, even though there is the usual cartoon mayhem.  Also, the oriental aesthetic is a refreshing change from the ordinary cartoon graphics.  Well done.
From the grandparents of a 5 year old boy

profile:
The user has a strong affinity for family-friendly entertainment and animated series that resonate with younger audiences. Their recent engagement with a popular animated series reinforces their commitment to content that offers action-packed narratives paired with strong moral themes. They appreciate the character integrity showcased in these series and value media that strikes a balance between fun and ethical lessons—qualities that underscore their thoughtful approach to children's programming.

The user also enjoys diverse cultural elements in animation, particularly those with a rich visual and thematic diversity that reflect their interest in varied aesthetics. This aligns with their nostalgic perspective as a septuagenarian, cherishing the experience of sharing modern shows with their grandchildren, particularly those featuring LEGO themes.

Moreover, the user emphasizes the importance of accessibility, expressing concern over regional limitations that can hinder the enjoyment of high-quality content. Their enthusiastic review highlights the appeal of shared experiences and creativity with their grandchildren, further illustrating their preference for morally engaging entertainment that fosters family bonding. Overall, the user seeks animated content that not only captivates young viewers but also resonates with older generations, ensuring shared enjoyment and meaningful lessons across age groups.
